name: Gunbae
address: 67 Murray St, New York, NY 10007, USA

reviews.text:
We found this place 12 years ago, came here all the time, left to our country, were away for 5 years and we finally came back
I love it to the moon and back
Food is to die for
Great Korean option in the neighborhood, good value as well

First time trying this place and it was an amazing KBBQ experience. Aayush was really kind and gave us great recommendations. Would definitely come again.

The food was delicious and our server Aayush was really helpful and helped us decide what to get. Highly recommend the combo, the beef was tender and juicy. The soup was warming and heartfelt. Highly recommend this place!
Aayush was n excellent server! Make sure to try their seafood pancake and Soju bomb!
Ordered wagyu and pork samgyup. Very expensive and low quantity and the servers took very long to start cooking them. Not satisfied.
Love going here when I want excellent Korean food, but I donâ€™t want to go to Korea Town. Highly recommend!
Great ambiance, great food, great service!
Tender meat and quick service!
My friends and I left very full! The combo is worth it for 3+ people!

Came here with a group of 15 out of town guests. Ellie took our reservation and was so easy to work with. Our servers were friendly and attentive; Joseph took the time to explain the menu and how it all worked. The meat was super tasty and great quality. Definitely a must go, especially if youâ€™re a big group looking for great Korean BBQ, this is the place to be. Thank you for a fun experience!

We made a reservation for 14 and were seated right away. Great spot for large groups. We ordered 3 combos for our table with beer, sangria and wine. What an amazing spread. The soups, bonchon and meats were amazing. We were in town visiting our kids from college and had a blast. Service was friendly, attentive and quick. Plus Joseph cooked all the food for us and did an awesome job. Thank you! We loved it and canâ€™t wait to come back.
We had a large group. The servers were all attentive and the food is delicious. Great experience overall.
Super expÃ©rience ! Y aller sans hÃ©siter. Ils vous cuisinent la viande Ã  votre table. Super.
came here for company HH, great food and karaoke
Best Korean I have ever had! Everyone that I take here falls in love. Amazing food and amazing vibes!!
Food, attitude ambience all great. Cant wait for the next time

My wife and I were looking for a place to eat that was close to our hotel and came across this place.

It was busy, but not too busy, and the food was exactly what we expected. The pickled onion / jalapeÃ±o was the best pairing for the beef and Ellieâ€™s service was spot on.

If we lived here, I could see this being a regular go to. Give it a try.

Gets 3 stars because of service. Food was delicious but the service was bad :/ The waitress was rushing us the whole time with was kind of rude, but the guys who cook the meat were super nice. Went with a group, maybe next time just me and one other person will be better.
Amazing food. Great service. Loved the bibimbap!
Nice place for friends to enjoy the Korean bbq. Good vibes and friendly staff. Unlimited side dishes and taste good!

Amazing food and fast service! Definitely would eat here again.
The place is amazing the fermented soy Bean paste with the proteins!
High quality food for a reasonable price. Service was excellent and we left very very very full. 6/5 would come back.
nice staff, clean, yummy!

Probably one of the worst tteokbokki I've ever had.  The sauce was watered down and soupy, the tteokbokki was dry inside, and the meat was also dry.  Service was meh, took order and brought bill.  That's the extent of it.
Korean BBQ restaurant in NYC.

Gunbae is the perfect blend of lively energy and authentic Korean BBQ flavor â€” think vibrant vibes, killer cocktails, and seriously delicious meat grilled right at your table. The atmosphere is upbeat and social, making it the ultimate spot for group nights or celebrations. The marinated short ribs and pork belly were standout hits, juicy and packed with flavor, while the banchan kept the experience fresh and balanced. The staff was friendly and kept the good times rolling without missing a beat. If you want a fun, flavorful Korean BBQ experience with a modern twist, Gunbaeâ€™s got you covered.
This place is amazing! The staff was friendly and really helpful. 10/10 would recommend

Had a terrible experience while dining here. I was really excited to try this restaurant out after seeing the wide variety on the menu. However, i was hesitant to after seeing the B health review on the door. The servers were inattentive to me and my friends. We constantly had to get their attention to place our order, ask for water/refills, and after receiving our order they didnâ€™t check up on us once. The food itself was decent but the service was horrible. They werenâ€™t even that busy to ignore us. For that reason I wouldnâ€™t come back. We were fed up to the point where when we were ready to pay and leave it took them over 15 mins to get the check from us so we had to get up and go to the front ourselves. I wouldnâ€™t go back here again.
Great location and service, they are super fast! And the food is delicious, I enjoyed it a lot. Loved this cozy spot. Will definitely come back!
Came here for a birthday party. It had good vibes. Didnâ€™t realize there was karaoke. Cool!
Great food!
Delicious food and ambiance
Love gunbae, one of the best korean spots in town
Nice Korean restaurant nee to reservations
Gunbae is amazing.  Great food!
The food here was so good, would definitely come back!
Had a good experience at Gunbae. The meat was good quality and everything tasted delicious.

We really enjoyed the BBQ here! The combo was excellentâ€”we had the Wagyu and bulgogi, which were both fresh and juicy. Service was great and everything was handled for us very well by Ayush. Highly recommend!
Tasty appetizers and delicious food with generous portions. Great place for lunch!
Yo soy delicious. Anticipation strong. Food yum. Exposed brick. Cool. Fire. Like literally.

This place used to have much better service so I docked a star. I dined alone and the wait staff barely paid attention to me.  The ban-Chan was served all at once with the meal (thatâ€™s not traditional!) and the wait staff never came around after bringing my food. Empty beerâ€”Empty banchanâ€”Who cares?  I practically had to put my jacket on for them to realize I was waiting for the checkâ€¦20 min later.
Lucky for them the food is ok.
Awesomeness

The restaurant was half empty and it took 20 min before anyone came to take our order. Prices are a bit steep for what it is, you can get better deals for the same quality elsewhere. Not worth waiting extra long for overpriced food.

Waited 25 minutes to order and they took the table next to us order when they came in 15 minutes later. Unacceptable. Never will go again. They only have good reviews because they give free alcohol if you give a good review. The workers are not even Korean. DO NOT TRUST!

Aayush took care of us from beginning to end! He made our food with extra love and really made us feel welcomed as this is the first stop we did in New York. Would highly recommend this place for the service and tasty meat!
Amazing place for good food and atmosphere. Shoutout to Aayush for serving us. Had a great time

This restaurant is literally the best. When I visited here, I was impressed by the kindness of the staff and atmosphere. The foods were wonderful, especially banchan(small side dishes) ã…¡ genuine Korean taste!

Simplistic and delicious. I crave Korean food and was pleased to come across Gunbae on the lower west side. We ordered japchae with veggies and tofu bibimbap, along with banchan - it was an absolute perfect lunch! Service was friendly, attentive and food came out quick. We came on a Wednesday at noon when they opened without a reservation & we were seated right away.

Traditional Korean fare in downtown NYC. Comes with free condiments to give you a good starter before the main course comes about. Soup abit blend and the taste of the food have definitely deviated from the traditional Korean fare.

Atmosphere is great for a get together for sure.

Absolutely stellar Korean BBQ experience at Gunbae! The food was delicious and fresh, but what really stood out was the impeccable service. Michael was incredibly attentive and friendly, and Jose was super helpful throughout our meal. Highly recommend â€” canâ€™t wait to come back!

We visited this well-maintained restaurant for dinner on a Thursday night. It was quite busy, with most tables displaying reserved signs. Despite the crowd, the layout was thoughtfully spaced, so it didnâ€™t feel overcrowded. I appreciated the bench design with built-in storageâ€”it was convenient for stowing our belongings. The BBQ was flavorful, especially the spiced pork belly, though the portion sizes were on the smaller side. A staff member handled the grilling for us and cooked the meat perfectly. We especially enjoyed the side dishes, and the waitstaff were happy to provide refills when we asked. Overall, it was a great experienceâ€”we just wish the portions were a bit more generous.

Love it! Went here for late lunch on a Subday and had the BBQ and chose wagyu brisket and ribeye steak. Loved the ribeye better. Wagyu brisket was good too, but I kept looking at the kalbi from my neighbors lol I also very much enjoyed the sides and the sauces. The kimchi, other lighter color cabbage, and onions are delicious. Fluffy eggs at the beginning were nice too. Even the Seoul Soul Ale beer was very nice. Ended up very satisfied but without feeling extremely stuffed.

Amazing Korean BBQ Experience â€“ More Than 5 Stars!

GUNBAE in Tribeca was one of the best dining experiences of my life! My family and I had the Combo C, and it was absolutely phenomenal. The flavors, the quality of the meat, and the whole experience were just perfect.

The staff was friendly and attentive, making sure everything was just right. The grilling at the table added to the fun, and the atmosphere was lively yet comfortable.

Even my family, who usually donâ€™t say much about food, absolutely loved it! If I could give more than 5 stars, I definitely would. Highly recommend for anyone looking for top-tier Korean BBQ in NYC!

This is the worst dining experience I have ever had! I am not sure the man stand in front desk is the owner or what, his behavior is the worst at all the time. We pay 20 percent of gratuities and he doesnâ€™t even help my mother to open the door when she carried the stroller walking out. And I asked for the sauce not spicy, he said have you tried? I said not yet. He arrogantly told me â€œtry first â€. The food is ok, but with his manners, it just downgraded. Over all, I donâ€™t suggest this place, it doesnâ€™t deserve the high ranking on google map.

One of the amazing restaurants in Lower Manhattan! We visited for my friend's birthday lunch. The atmosphere is so chic and modern. The decor is decent, and they have spacious tables for bigger groups. We indulged in fantastic cocktails such as margaritas, Manhattan, old-fashioned, and appletini, all expertly crafted and definitely strong. Our order included the Gunbae Hansang combo, veggie bibimbap, and Dduk Mandu Guk soup with veggie dumplings and vegetables - everything was scrumptious and delightful. A staff member even came to our table to prepare the BBQ for the combo, which was a fantastic experience. My friends and I had a wonderful time, and although they close at 3 pm, they didn't rush us; we left at 3:15. To top it off, they surprised us with a small ice cream topped with a candle to celebrate my friend's birthday. Excellent service, delicious food, and a nice place for Korean cuisine!
Love the atmosphere at Gunbae. The meat quality is excellent and the attentive servers cook the food for you. Thereâ€™s also a karaoke area downstairs which is pretty cool.
We really enjoyed the BBQ here! The combo was excellentâ€”especially the Wagyu and pork, which were both fresh and juicy. Great food and friendly service. Highly recommend!

How could I have not come here any sooner? Gunbae in Tribeca is an absolute gem for Korean BBQ lovers. From the moment you walk in, the vibrant and energetic atmosphere sets the stage for an unforgettable dining experience. The staff is incredibly attentive, guiding you through the menu and expertly handling the grill at your table.

The quality of the meats is top-notch, with each cut perfectly marinated and bursting with flavor. The variety is impressive, from tender beef short ribs to succulent pork belly, all cooked to perfection right in front of you. The banchan (side dishes) are plentiful and complement the main dishes beautifully, adding to the authentic Korean experience.

The interactive element of grilling at your table makes it a fun and engaging meal, whether youâ€™re with friends, family, or colleagues. The

Gunbae is more than just a meal; itâ€™s an experience. If you havenâ€™t been yet, make it a priority. Itâ€™s a spot that will quickly become a favorite for any fan of Korean BBQ.
Mike is a sweetheart and awesome!! He showed us the Soju Bomb which Iâ€™ve only seen in the Korean TV Shows! It was a great place with delicious food! Like it!

We met a couple of Korean boys at Time Square and they recommended this restaurant. Boy were they right to do so! We had such a great time with awesome food, great drinks and education from the staff on how to â€˜do Korean bbqâ€™ğŸ¤©
